content: Released in 1954, the film directed by P. Bhaskaran and Ramu Kariat was a landmark in Malayalam cinema

content: Former State Congress president Akhilesh Prasad Singh said Rahul Gandhi is likely to be in Bihar for over a fortnight till the ‚ÄòVote Adhikar Yatra‚Äô concludes

title: Revisiting Katou-Indel in 17th-century botanical¬†treatise Hortus Malabaricus yields new finds for researchers
content: Recent studies on the palm, named Katou-Indel in Hortus Malabaricus, have led researchers to conclude that the trees found in Kerala and Sri Lanka and elsewhere in India and neighbouring Bangladesh and Pakistan are two distinct species of the genus Phoenix

title: Three arrested in fraud case, bank accounts frozen
content: The accused established Upix Creations, an animation company, at Satyanarayanapuram area and collected about ‚Çπ350 crore from 183 depositors and duped them, the police said

content: Parts of Kota, Ajmer, Jaipur, Bharatpur and Bikaner divisions are likely to experience light to moderate rain accompanied by thunder

content: Consul General of India in Seattle Prakash Gupta along with Mayor of Seattle Bruce Harrell and other select dignitaries from the Seattle city leadership joined the historic and landmark occasion

content: Long traffic snarl remains for hours and alternative routes have been suggested for airport-bound passengers

content: Officer-in-Charge of RIT police station Sanjeev Kumar Singh said the Sub-Inspector‚Äôs body was found with blood oozing out of the nose and ears

content: Ram Madhav praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for recognising the 100-year history of the RSS during his Independence Day speech.

content: As per sources in the police, the Central agencies had detected the frequent communication between Mohammad and suspected Pakistani terrorist outfits through some social media platforms

content: In a strongly worded statement, Pinarayi says Centre belittled Independence Day by attempting to fete RSS which he states was ‚Äòunabashedly servile to the colonial rulers and repeatedly betrayed the freedom movement‚Äô

title: J&K Cloudburst: Explosives Used To Blast Giant Boulders To Speed Up Rescue Efforts
content: Explosives were used to blast giant boulders hampering the ongoing rescue and relief operations in the disaster-hit Chisoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on the third day on Saturday, officials said.

title: At Least 320 Killed In Pakistan Due To Monsoon In Last 48 Hours
content: Rescuers were struggling to retrieve bodies from debris after flash floods triggered by heavy monsoon rains across northern Pakistan killed at least 321 people in the past 48 hours, authorities said on Saturday.

title: Hours After Alaska Meet, Russia Fired 85 Drones, 1 Missile On Ukraine: Kyiv
content: Russia launched 85 attack drones and a ballistic missile at Ukraine overnight, Kyiv said Saturday, hours after Russian leader Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump held their Alaska talks.

title: Ukrainians See "Nothing" Good From Trump-Putin Meeting
content: Pavlo Nebroev stayed up until the middle of the night in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv to wait for a press conference between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin thousands of kilometres away.

title: Alaska Meet Live Updates: After Putin Meeting, Ukraine's Zelensky To Meet Trump In Washington On Monday
content: Trump-Putin Alaska Meet Live Updates:¬†Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, did not reach a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine after talks in¬†Alaska.

title: "Trump Didn't Lose, Putin Clearly Won": Ex-US NSA John Bolton On Alaska Summit
content: Former US national security advisor John Bolton said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "clearly won" at the Alaska Summit, although US President Donald Trump "did not lose", regarding the Ukraine peace deal.

title: IndiGo Aircraft's Tail Hits Runway During Go-Around At Mumbai Airport
content: An IndiGo Airbus A321 aircraft's tail touched the runway while powering up for a go-around manoeuvre in low altitude due to bad weather in Mumbai on Saturday, the airline said.

title: "Told Trump Russia Sanctions Should Be Strengthened Unless...": Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he will meet US President Donald Trump in Washington on Monday after a Russia-US summit ended without an agreement to stop the fighting in Ukraine after 3 1/2 years.

title: Amid Telangana Congress Infighting, MLA Speaks Of "Chief Minister's Approval"
content: In a sharp escalation of infighting within the Telangana Congress, MLA Komatireddy Rajagopal Reddy mentioned Chief Minister Revanth Reddy's name while talking about bills not being cleared, adding at the same time that he was not criticising anyone.

title: Daman Man Kills His 2 Specially-Abled Children, Hangs Self After Wife Leaves Him: Cops
content: A man allegedly murdered his two differently-abled children and then hanged himself in Silvassa in the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu after his wife left him recently, police said on Saturday.

title: Trump-Putin Meet Over, European Leaders To Keep Sanctions Pressure On Russia
content: European leaders Saturday said they were "ready to uphold the pressure" on Russia through sanctions following a summit between presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin.

title: Mumbai Dahi Handi Govinda Team Sets 10-Tier Human Pyramid Record
content: The Dahi Handi festivities in Maharashtra witnessed a historic moment as Jogeshwari's Konkan Nagar Govinda Pathak set a world record by forming a 10-tier human pyramid.

title: "World Wants Early End To Ukraine War": India Welcomes Trump-Putin Summit
content: India has welcomed the Alaska summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin as a "commendable" step towards ending the Ukraine war.

title: Found Concrete Evidence That YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra Spied For Pak: Sources
content: A 2,500-page chargesheet has been filed against YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra after three months of investigation and, sources said, the police have found concrete evidence that she was spying for Pakistan.

title: Vivek Agnihotri's 'Bengal Files' Kolkata Trailer Cancelled, He Says...
content: Director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, who is gearing up for his upcoming directorial 'The Bengal Files', hit a roadblock on Saturday in Kolkata.

title: Jammu And Kashmir Cloudburst Highlights: Rescue Ops On As 46 Killed In Kishtwar, Chief Minister Cancels Independence Day Cultural Events
content: At least 46 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel,¬†after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: Jayant Chaudhary Sends A Message By Abstaining From Constitution Club Polls
content: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief and Union Minister of State Jayant Chaudhary chose to abstain from voting in the Constitution Club of India elections this week, a decision that has created ripples in the political circles.

title: Man Runs From Immigration Officers In US, Dies After Getting Hit By Car
content: A man fleeing immigration authorities outside a Home Depot store in Southern California was struck and killed by an SUV when he ran across a nearby freeway.

title: Who Will Be Next Vice President? A Look At BJP's Probable Candidates
content: With less than a month to go for the Vice Presidential poll, the BJP has begun work in full swing to finalise its nominee and started discussions on its potential picks that include Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

title: PM Modi To Inaugurate Delhi Section Of Dwarka Expressway Tomorrow: Key Details
content: The Dwarka Expressway is set to transform daily commutes with faster connectivity, advanced design features and a direct link to IGI Airport.

title: 'Trump's tariffs on India stupid': US economist Sachs' key message for New Delhi
content: Economist Jeffrey Sachs criticizes Donald Trump's tariff policies as detrimental to the US economy and a violation of international law, warning of potential legal challenges and geopolitical isolation. Sachs suggests Trump's actions stem from a desire to dominate other nations, particularly BRICS countries, and a flawed approach to the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: 'Death staring in face': Pak floods kill 344; helicopter crash, mass funerals, destruction
content: Northern Pakistan is reeling from devastating flash floods triggered by intense monsoon rains, resulting in at least 344 fatalities in just 48 hours. The Buner district is the hardest hit, with rescue operations severely hampered by washed-out roads and ongoing heavy rainfall. With more rain expected, officials fear the situation will worsen in the climate-vulnerable nation.

title: AUS vs SA: 'Big Show' Maxwell roars as Australia clinch last-over thriller to seal series
content: Glenn Maxwell's explosive 62* off 36 balls propelled Australia to a thrilling two-wicket victory over South Africa in Cairns, securing the T20I series 2-1. Maxwell's calm approach and match-winning reverse scoop sealed the win after Marsh and Head's steady partnership. Australia's recent T20I form, including series wins against multiple teams, positions them as a formidable force.

title: Satya Nadella: Bill Gates‚Äô vision guided us for decades, but...
content: Satya Nadella declared Microsoft's need for reinvention in the age of AI, moving beyond Bill Gates' software factory vision. Despite record financial performance and workforce reductions, Microsoft aims to empower 8 billion people with AI tools. The company is restructuring around security, quality, and AI transformation, envisioning a future where everyone has access to AI agents.

title: ‚Äò16 days, 23 districts‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi launches 'Vote Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi launched the "Vote Adhikar Yatra" in Bihar, protesting alleged voter roll manipulation by the Election Commission ahead of state elections. The 16-day yatra, supported by Mahagathbandhan allies, aims to raise awareness and protect voting rights. Tejashwi Yadav emphasized ensuring no voter is excluded, while Gandhi accuses the EC of collusion with the BJP, a claim the EC denies.

title: 'Two or three weeks': Trump on slapping China with Russian oil tariff
content: US President Donald Trump has indicated potential retaliatory tariffs on China for its Russian oil purchases, following similar actions against India. While immediate measures are not planned, Trump suggested they could be implemented in the coming weeks if the Ukraine war persists.

title: 'Set this book on fire': Congress slams NCERT Partition module; BJP hits back
content: A political clash erupted between Congress and BJP. This happened after NCERT released new modules on Partition. The modules placed blame on Congress. Congress refuted the claims. They accused Hindu Mahasabha and Muslim League of collaboration. BJP accused Congress of avoiding inconvenient history. NCERT stated Congress accepted Partition plans. They underestimated Jinnah.

title: After $100M bonuses & 'warning', OpenAI employees can sell $6bn in stock
content: OpenAI is in discussions for a secondary share sale, potentially valuing the company at $500 billion, allowing employees to cash in on their equity amidst intense competition for AI talent. SoftBank is significantly increasing its stake in OpenAI, projecting massive revenue growth and ambitious plans to invest trillions in AI infrastructure.

title: 'Frustrating, but ...': Karun Nair on England tour; lauds Gill, Gambhir for clarity
content: India batter Karun Nair reflected on a bittersweet Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series in England, acknowledging his frustration at not converting starts into big scores despite batting well. He took pride in India's 2-2 series draw against England, crediting the team's resilience and clear messaging from captain Shubman Gill and coach Gautam Gambhir.

title: Alaska meet: Putin reveals US-Russia trade grew by 20% under Trump
content: "Incidentally, when the new administration came to power (in the US), bilateral trade started to grow. It's still very symbolic. Still, we have a growth of 20 per cent," Putin said.

title: GST 2.0: 'What Rahul says, happens' - Cong claims credit for PM Modi's Diwali gift
content: Prime Minister Modi's Independence Day announcement of a simplified GST structure, dubbed GST 2.0, aiming for cheaper daily-use items, has sparked a political clash. The Congress party claims the idea as their own, referencing their 2024 manifesto and Rahul Gandhi's past calls for similar reforms.

title: 'I‚Äôm not a person who...': Former Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal launches AI startup
content: Parag Agrawal, ex-CEO of Twitter, is now leading Parallel Web Systems. This AI startup focuses on improving AI agents for computer tasks. It secured $30 million in funding, including from Vinod Khosla. Parallel aims to enhance AI's web search capabilities. Agrawal's team operates from Palo Alto. He wants this venture to define his career post-Twitter.

title: 'We wish Ukraine...': PM Modi thanks Zelenskyy for Independence Day greetings
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed gratitude to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for his Independence Day greetings, emphasizing the commitment to strengthen bilateral ties and hoping for peace in Ukraine.

title: 'Chess doesn't fit women properly': How Divya plans to defy Kasparov's 36-yo remark
content: In 1989, Garry Kasparov claimed women were weaker fighters in chess. Judit Polgar proved him wrong, crossing 2700. Now, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh, fresh off her Women‚Äôs World Cup triumph and Grandmaster title, is stepping into the Open Grand Swiss 2025. Backed by coach Shyam Sundar, her bold move echoes Polgar‚Äôs path and signals higher ambitions.

title: 'Education is not an event, you can learn forever,' says Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas
content: Aravind Srinivas, CEO of Perplexity AI, has shaken the tech world with a $34.5 billion bid to acquire Google Chrome, a bold move that dwarfs his company‚Äôs valuation. Speaking at the Oxford Union, he urged students to embrace lifelong learning, declaring, ‚ÄúEducation is not an event. You can choose to stop, or you can choose to learn forever.‚Äù

title: Asia Cup: Former batter shocks by leaving Gill out of playing XI; check full team
content: Mohammad Kaif has unveiled his predicted India squad for the Asia Cup 2025, sparking debate by including Shubman Gill in the 15-member team but excluding him from the playing XI. Kaif's surprising choices feature Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma as openers, with Suryakumar Yadav leading the side and Axar Patel as vice-captain.

title: After US, is UK also losing its appeal for Indian students? Visa data suggests so
content: Indian mobility to the UK is witnessing a steep decline, with Home Office data showing work visas for Indians halved to 81,463 in 2024 and student visas dropping 42% from the previous year. Policy shifts, including salary hikes and restrictions on dependants, are reshaping choices, pushing Indian students and professionals to reconsider Britain as a destination.

title: Straight to peace deal? Trump to meet Zelenskyy; will talk to Putin 'if all works out'
content: Following a meeting in Alaska, President Trump announced his preference for a direct peace agreement to end the Russia-Ukraine war, rather than a ceasefire. Zelenskyy is scheduled to visit Washington D.C. on Monday, with a potential meeting with Putin to follow if discussions progress positively. Both leaders have expressed openness to negotiations, signaling a potential path toward resolving the conflict.

title: Serious Injury Replacement: BCCI introduces new rule after Pant's injury
content: The BCCI has introduced a "Serious Injury Replacement" rule for multi-day domestic cricket starting in the 2025-26 season, prompted by injuries in the recent India-England series. This allows teams to replace players injured by external blows, like fractures, with like-for-like substitutes approved by the match referee. While welcomed by some, like India's coach Gautam Gambhir, the rule has faced criticism.

title: Watch: Ouch! Fan crashes into the fence while trying to catch Brevis six
content: Dewald Brevis's explosive innings, featuring audacious no-look sixes, electrified the Australia-South Africa T20I. One fan's eagerness to catch a souvenir resulted in a comical collision with the boundary fence, quickly going viral. Brevis's 53 off 26 balls propelled South Africa to a competitive total, providing entertainment both on and off the field.

title: Arjun follows in parents Sachin-Anjali's footsteps after engagement with Saaniya
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of Sachin Tendulkar, is engaged to Sanniya Chandhok on August 13, 2025. The couple's age difference mirrors Sachin's marriage to Anjali, who was older than him. Arjun, a cricketer, follows in his father's footsteps both on and off the field, embracing a relationship that defies societal norms, much like his father did.

title: Ukraine-Russia war: EU leaders back Zelenskyy‚Äôs right to choose alliances
content: European leaders affirmed that Russia cannot dictate Ukraine's alliances. This came after talks between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin failed to end the Ukraine war. Europe pledged to support Ukraine's right to choose its future. Trump aimed for a deal, but key issues remained unresolved. Putin welcomed the talks and called for cooperation.

title: Talks on border issue: Chinese FM Wang Yi to visit India next week
content: "At the invitation of national security advisor Shri Ajit Doval, Member of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China and Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi will visit India on 18-19 August 2025," the MEA stated in a release.

title: '10/10' Alaska meeting: Inconclusive Trump-Putin talks leave India in limbo; here's how
content: The Alaska meeting between Trump and Putin concluded without a clear agreement, despite Trump's positive assessment. Putin emphasized addressing Russia's concerns, including Nato expansion, before any peace deal. Trump hinted at potential secondary tariffs on India for Russian oil purchases but deferred immediate action, leaving New Delhi uncertain about its trade relations.

title: ‚ÄòSome people came...‚Äô: ‚ÄòThe Bengal Files‚Äô trailer launch disrupted
content: A controversy erupted in Kolkata during the trailer release of ‚ÄòThe Bengal Files.‚Äô Actress Pallavi Joshi alleged disruption, questioning freedom of expression in West Bengal and comparing the situation unfavorably to Kashmir. Director Vivek Agnihotri condemned the incident as dictatorship, citing disrupted event arrangements.

title: Watch: Dewald Brevis smashes hat-trick of no-look sixes; fan jumps fence to catch ball
content: Dewald Brevis stunned spectators in the third T20I against Australia with an explosive innings. The South African batsman showcased his power-hitting ability, highlighted by three consecutive no-look sixes off Aaron Hardie. Brevis's audacious display sent the crowd into a frenzy, with one fan even attempting to retrieve a ball by jumping over the fence.

title: ‚ÄòHelmet too big‚Äô: Pretorius leaves fans in splits during 3rd T20I - Watch
content: During a recent T20I match between Australia and South Africa, Proteas batter Lhuan-dre Pretorius provided a comical interlude. While facing Josh Hazlewood, his helmet slipped, obscuring his vision as he ran between wickets. Despite the laughter, Pretorius showcased his talent with a rapid 24 off 15 balls, including five boundaries.

title: ICC U19 World Cup 2026: Full line-up confirmed, USA seal final spot
content: The USA secured the final spot in the ICC U19 Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup 2026, joining 15 other teams in Zimbabwe and Namibia. They dominated the Americas Qualifier, led by Arjun Mahesh, while Tanzania, Afghanistan, Japan, and Scotland also qualified through regional tournaments. The event promises to showcase future stars, blending traditional powerhouses with emerging talents.

title: How Goa managed to tame rabies: Inside state's drive that vaccinated 63k dogs in 30 days
content: Goa achieved a "rabies-controlled" status in 2021 after eliminating human rabies cases since 2017, following a 2014 outbreak that claimed 17 lives. Mission Rabies initiated mass vaccination and sterilization drives, significantly reducing cases. Cross-border transmission from neighboring states remains a challenge, prompting intensified vaccination efforts in border regions and mandatory pet vaccination declarations for visitors.

title: ‚ÄòFinally woken up‚Äô: Cong demands discussion on GST 2.0 announced by PM
content: Following PM Modi's GST reform announcement, Congress demands a discussion paper, advocating for a simplified tax structure. Jairam Ramesh suggests rate reductions and extending the GST compensation cess to aid states. PM Modi plans GST revisions around Diwali, promising relief to consumers and small businesses by reducing tax rates on essential goods.

title: ‚ÄòRussia lost an oil client, which is India‚Äô: What Trump said before meeting Putin
content: US President Trump imposed a 25% tariff on India for its Russian crude oil trade, claiming it cost Russia a major client. Trump's remarks came after his recent decision to implement a 50% tariff on India‚Äôs exports to the US, citing India's oil trade with Russia as the reason.

title: Jason Whitlock sides with Dave Portnoy in brutal critique of Hailee Steinfeld‚Äôs Sinners
content: Hailee Steinfeld's movie 'Sinners' faces criticism despite its financial success. Dave Portnoy's remarks ignited debate, with Jason Whitlock agreeing. Some praise the film's style, performances, and world-building. Others find it overrated. Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld were seen shopping. Allen prepares for the Buffalo Bills' season opener against the Baltimore Ravens. 'Sinners' continues to spark discussion.

title: 'Like doomsday': Pak floods wreak havoc; over 320 killed; video captures devastation
content: Devastating flash floods in Pakistan, triggered by intense monsoon rains, have claimed at least 321 lives in the last 48 hours. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province is the worst hit, with entire villages destroyed and communities cut off. Rescue efforts are underway, but hampered by washed-out roads and ongoing rainfall.

title: 'Chori chori, chupke chupke': Rahul shares new video as part of 'vote theft' campaign; watch
content: Rahul Gandhi intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, employing a parody video to highlight alleged vote theft. The Congress party has launched a "Vote Chori se Azaadi" campaign and announced a "VoterAdhikarYatra" from Bihar, directly challenging perceived electoral manipulation.

title: 'Historic first': Tricolour hoisted at Seattle‚Äôs iconic 605-feet-tall Space Needle; watch
content: In a historic moment, the Indian flag flew atop Seattle's Space Needle on Independence Day. Consul General Prakash Gupta and Mayor Bruce Harrell attended the event. Several iconic buildings were illuminated in tricolour. King County and other cities declared August 15 as India Day. The event highlighted the strong ties between India and the US Pacific Northwest.

title: 'Congress caused partition': NCERT's new module blames party for 'blunders'; key extracts
content: NCERT's new modules on the Partition of India place significant responsibility on the Congress leadership. The modules assert that Congress leaders accepted Partition plans, underestimated Jinnah's influence, and failed to anticipate the long-term consequences of the division. The material highlights Jinnah's demands and warnings as key factors that led to the Partition, questioning the haste in transferring power.

title: F-1 visa rejections explained: What‚Äôs fuelling student refusals; how you can avoid them
content: Many international students face F-1 visa denials under Section 214(b) due to perceived lack of ties to their home country. This refusal isn't permanent, and applicants can reapply with strengthened evidence of these ties, such as family commitments or property ownership. The DIGNITY Act, if approved, may ease restrictions by allowing dual intent for F-1 visas.

title: 'War 2' box office: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara starrer crosses Rs 100 cr mark; Janmashtami may hit day 3 biz
content: Released on August 14th, 'War 2' clashed with 'Coolie' at the box office. Despite a weaker opening day with ‚Çπ51.5 crore compared to 'Coolie's' ‚Çπ65 crore, 'War 2' surged on Independence Day, collecting ‚Çπ56.50 crore. The film has crossed ‚Çπ100 crore in two days, fueled by Hindi belt growth and Jr NTR's Telugu version success.

title: 1999 Saudi murder case: CBI nabs fugitive at Delhi airport; lived 25 yrs under fake ID
content: Mohammad Dilshad, a fugitive wanted for a 1999 murder in Saudi Arabia, was apprehended by the CBI at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after evading authorities for over two decades. The arrest followed a request from Saudi Arabian authorities and a CBI investigation that uncovered Dilshad's use of a fake passport to travel abroad.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy downpour floods streets, railway tracks flooded, red alert sounded
content: Mumbai grappled with heavy rainfall on Saturday, leading to waterlogged streets and a tragic landslide in Vikhroli that claimed two lives and injured two others. The IMD has issued a red alert for Mumbai and neighboring districts, forecasting continued intense rainfall. In Himachal Pradesh, the monsoon death toll has reached 257, with widespread disruptions to roads and essential services.

title: Kangana Ranaut on live-in hypocrisy: ‚ÄòMen can impregnate and run‚Äô; reacts after Khushboo Patani‚Äôs criticism
content: Amidst the ongoing debate on live-in relationships sparked by controversial remarks, Kangana Ranaut shares her perspective, emphasizing the importance of marriage in society. She highlights the promise of loyalty a man makes to his wife and suggests that live-in relationships may not be as woman-friendly as they seem.

title: 'Tu kab se mera baap ban gaya?': How Irfan Pathan shut an abusive Afridi
content: Irfan Pathan revealed a heated exchange with Shahid Afridi during a 2006 flight from Karachi to Lahore. Afridi's initial taunt led to a verbal altercation, escalating when Pathan jokingly inquired about dog meat, implying Afridi had consumed it.

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: ‚õ≥ Augusta National ditches masses for revenue
content: the 2026 "Official Masters Hospitality" program includes offers of housing, transportation, catering and so on to the corporate and/or well-heeled . the "Full Scale, Private Home Program," which will run you a mere $219,600 for the week, comes days after the announcement that a local Hooters restaurant is closing .

title: NFL preseason Week 2 takeaways: Seahawks' Zach Charbonnet, Titans' Elic Ayomanor come up big
content: the second week of the 2025 preseason kicked off on friday as several teams prepare to give extended looks to their starters in a dress rehearsal for the regular season . the team's reporters summarized the games below to keep you updated on how teams fared .

title: What NFL scouts make of Arch Manning, what Texas can expect from him
content: arch Manning will get his chance to be the face of the longhorns this season . he won't get the chance to ease into the starting role as top-ranked Texas will play at defending national champion and no. 3-ranked Ohio State in its season opener on august 30 .

title: 'It's just not worth it': Why the Dodgers won't rush Ohtani -- no matter their record
content: Shohei Ohtani is the first 50/50 player in baseball history . he has attempted five steals in 12 games in august . it's a small part of a bigger conflict between what he can do and what the Dodgers believe .

title: Fantasy baseball news: Duran carted off, Muncy sidelined with oblique strain
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the remaining 14 games were played under the lights, with four more matinees following, with the final 10 games being evening affairs . for the second straight day, action gets underway at 2:20 p.m. ET .

title: ‚öæ MLB awards: Sanchez or Skenes for NL Cy Young?
content: this month's awards watch reflects changes atop some races and separation in others . the two methods of tracking these things are in complete accord when it comes to anointing the current favorites . a lot can and will change in short period of time in a big league baseball season .

title: From 'KGB' to Central Michigan: What we learned, and didn't learn, from the Michigan report
content: Connor Stalions referred to his advanced sign-stealing operation as both "counterintelligence" and "the KGB" the former Michigan staffer called the video it elicited "dirty film" and ultimately threw his phone in a pond . the punishments for that operation arrived on Friday .
